p: The broader term of terpenoids is applied to terpene-related molecules that, in addiction to isoprene units, contain other substituents, for instance, oxygenated functional groups [ 102]. Many other natural substances, such as alkaloids, phenolics, and vitamins, despite deriving from biosynthetic pathways other than mevalonate (i.e., acetate or shikimate), are sometimes classified as meroterpenoids since they present isoprenic moieties in their structure.
